body_html:
I agree that returning a vector is unexpected here. But I was under the impression that 0.3.1 (before the tensor variable merge) behaved that way. I’ll test and report back here.
…
On Thu, Jul 26, 2018 at 11:08 Adam Paszke ***@***.***> wrote: I'm also not very happy with stacking the scalars. We've discussed that in #7973 <#7973>, where @SsnL <https://github.com/SsnL> claimed that this was the behavior before his fix, so I passed on arguing further. However, if this wasn't the case in the previous release, then I do think we should raise an error if we see scalar outputs. @SsnL <https://github.com/SsnL>? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
I agree that returning a vector is unexpected here. But I was under the
impression that 0.3.1 (before the tensor variable merge) behaved that way.
I’ll test and report back here.

On Thu, Jul 26, 2018 at 11:08 Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I'm also not very happy with stacking the scalars. We've discussed that in
> #7973 <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7973>, where @SsnL
> <https://github.com/SsnL> claimed that this was the behavior before his
> fix, so I passed on arguing further. However, if this wasn't the case in
> the previous release, then I do think we should raise an error if we see
> scalar outputs. @SsnL <https://github.com/SsnL>?
>
> —
